hi folks: Is there a rescue mode on the karmic i386 desktop cd?
I wanted to try reinstalling the grub loader, since I can't get karmic to boot.
To state why I need to try a reinstall of grub: I did a fresh install of karmic-desktop and it won't boot.  All previous ubuntu versions have been in a multi-boot environment, np.
What happens when you try to boot?
Nothing, just the grub line, then one return/enter, then hangs.
Interesting, try asking in #grub ( and so you know, karmic uses grub2 which uses grub.cfg and is all that they support in #grub )
Ubuntu installed grub silently, without asking me for any feedback, and it still wouldn't boot.
Did you see my question: does my install cd have a rescue mode?  I thought I'd try reinstalling grub.
Did you use the liveCD or the alternate CD? The liveCD is one big full fearured rescue mode in itself :)
Does that sentence make sense to you in what I did?
Yes
Boot the LiveCD and choose the "try ubuntu without any changes" option to boot to a full desktop. From there you can re-install grub, though I don't think that will help
Do you think it matters how I installed?  I.e., should I try to install while being booted from the liveCD?
No, it makes no difference ( it's the same installer )
You can try installing grub legacy
But before you do that you should really ask in #grub
losha, What problem are you having with grub2?
I just couldn't get either of the 9's to dual boot, or actually, to boot at all?  The system just hung at the grub prompt.

That usually means that you have multiple drives and grub was installed to the wrong one ( leaving a broken previous version of grub on the drive you are actually booting from ) or you have a BIOS bug.
Do you have more than one drive?
What do you think?
